summary: Harold A. Rose was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are payroll certifications from October 1977, November 1977, and May 1978, listing Rose's name, position, and salary during those periods. While the specific role of Harold A. Rose within the HSCA is not detailed in these documents, the payroll certifications confirm his employment with the committee during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Harold A. Rose's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. As a staff member, he contributed to the committee's work, although the specific nature and impact of his contributions are not evident from the provided payroll certifications.
